definition: frame (e.g. door frame)/casing/fig. framework/template/to circle (i.e. draw a circle around sth)/to frame/to restrict/Taiwan pr. [kuang1]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: These boxes can also hold the descriptions of these components.
sentences.chinese: 这些可以在框子旁边标注这些组件的描述。

sentences.english: I still have that school paper framed over the fire place.
sentences.chinese: 我至今还把我在学习的那篇文章用框子框在壁炉上。

sentences.english: The ugly frame detracts from the beauty of the famous picture.
sentences.chinese: 难看的框子有损这幅名画的美。

sentences.english: I want this poster framed and hung in my house.
sentences.chinese: 我想这海报框子挂在我的家里。

sentences.english: Draw a box around your answer.
sentences.chinese: 他把一张画嵌进框子里。

sentences.english: Beads shall be fitted at the factory and delivered attached to frames.
sentences.chinese: 珠子应当在工厂安装，装上框子后发运。

sentences.english: He took a series of large tape reels from a cupboard .
sentences.chinese: 他从一个框子里取出了一套很大的磁带盘。

sentences.english: The frame is made of metal.
Draw and color a self-portrait in the box.
sentences.chinese: 在这个框子里画一个自画并涂上颜色。

sentences.english: He let a picture into the frame .
sentences.chinese: 他把一张画嵌进框子里。
